snippet: Senator Eric Adams told a federal judge — and Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly denied — that Mr. Kelly had said making young minority men fear the police was an objective.
abstract: Democratic Sen Eric Adams of Brooklyn, former New York Police Dept captain, testifies in Federal District Court in Manhattan about statements made by Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly in 2010 meeting about the use of stop-and-frisk tactics; Adams says Kelly stated that young black and Hispanic men were the focus of street stops because he wanted to instill fear of police in them; Kelly calls testimony categorically untrue.
lead_paragraph: Senator Eric Adams told a federal judge — and Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly denied — that Mr. Kelly had said making young minority men fear the police was an objective.

headline.seo: Kelly Intended Frisks to Instill Fear, Senator Testifies
headline.main: Kelly Said Street Stops Targeted Minorities, Senator Testifies
headline.print_headline: Kelly Said Street Stops Targeted Minorities, Senator Testifies
